availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Hoy, Jr. (Simpson County, Kentucky, millwright)

body.p: Simpson County, Kentucky, millwright. Kentucky native. Son of John Hoy Sr. and Sarah P. Hoy. Laborer in Simpson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1850. Millwright in Simpson County in 1860. Household owned thirty enslaved persons in Simpson County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 53B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 869.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 29.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Simpson County, p. 300B.
Find A Grave, "John M Hoy (4 Apr 1819-27 Sep 1878)," Memorial #80203553, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/80203553 (accessed September 1, 2020).
